review_title: Great Co-Workers/ Under Rated By Senior Management
job_title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist in Columbus, GA
pros:
Great Co-Workers
Good Doctors
Imaging Services is fairly stable as far as workers go, not many leaving....yet
cons:
Equipment constantly fails and requires technologists to restart equipment, put in work orders to get it fixed when it is beyond the technologists capability to do so.

Equipment that relies on wireless connections has to be reconnected to update work lists every time before exam, and up to three times to send the exam to PACS.

PACS is obsolete, needs to be replaced, slow, and malfunctions by either not accepting exams sent, sending exams into wrong patient's files, or the right patient, but a previous exam.

Employees are not valued and respected by senior management (unless they are a nurse).

Under paid, over worked (short staffed and not allowed to hire new staff to ease the stress and work load on employees).

Senior management makes promises and then seems to come up with reasons not to live up to those promises. It took three years to get a salary adjustment for our department. We were told that we were next on the list several times, only to see other departments get their salary adjustments before our department despite being told we were next.

The salary adjustment was not substantial enough to being us to parity, like we were told it would. Despite the claim that the company pays "competitive compensation" in the employee handbook, we are still paid several dollars an hour less than other hospitals in our area. The health insurance is structured in such a way that some prescriptions have to be filled at the hospital's pharmacy or a pharmacy with a reputation for errors in our area. Despite requests to allow coverage at other pharmacies in town, those requests are not answered at all. No response as to if the request is granted or denied, or being considered, nothing.

pros:
Good team work (on some floors)
Scanning system
cons: St. Francis was bought out by a major company, meaning employees are now just numbers and every action is guided towards profit.  Everything is micro managed, such as doing bedside shift reports with a nurse manager watching you, checking off boxes on a list.  High acuity patients for a horrible nurse to patient ratio of 1:6 (this is why there are so many falls).  Nurses and nurse techs are physically and mentally exhausted with the patient load.  The pay is extremely low compared to Savannah, GA.  Moreover, pay is always screwed up so you don't always get your critical pay or overtime.  If you are PRN, you always float to every other floor than the one you're hired on, and these floors are the most understaffed because everyone hates working there.  NO teamwork when you float, and horrible team assignments.

review_title: St. Francis Hospital - a place where you can make a difference.
pros: There is real purpose in the work and the culture of the hospital is consistent, high quality and remarkably supportive of excellence. I have never met so many bright, committed employees in one business. Over the last few years, the facilities have almost doubled in size, new services and equipment have been added, and the workforce has grown almost 20%, at the same time the attention to detail and close relationships with staff and patients have stayed the same. People take the time to say hello, notice when visitors are lost or need information, and go out of their way to be sure patients and their families are reassured. There is an atmosphere of calm, even though staff are busy and doing critical bedside care. This conveys confidence to everyone that health is on the way.
cons: Administrative departments are understaffed and IT is way behind in hardware and software systems.

job_title: Maintenance Mechanic I in Columbus, GA
pros: The people I work with are great. We all bring a lot of knowledge to the department of our own and always are willing to teach others what we know. we make a great team.
cons: The pay scale is not where it should be for the risks and hazards we face on a daily bases.We are constantly promoting Patient safety but at the same time put ourselves In harms way directly and indirectly. We are relied on 24 hours a day 7  days a week and sometimes give up our off time to respond to minor and major issues.

review_title: One of the better hospitals to work at in Tulsa but, then again, the choices here are pretty awful.
pros: Free parking. Progressive building & image in a small city market.
cons: The benefits & compensation are awful. SFH employees pay more for their company-owned healthcare than many local area Tulsans working for other companies. Compensation is below many other facilities in Tulsa. Both upper & mid- level management fail to strongly advocate for their nursing staff.

pros: loved my coworkers, my patients/families, the docs/staff, and my managers/supervisors.
cons: management influenced by people who were determined to run the show in spite of management. was "put out" of my job, one I was quite good at, because I was sick. Had FMLA, but was informed that every scheduled day, including hospital stay, was counted as a call in, and because I was on orders for 8 hr shifts only, I was in default of my PRN 3 status.

pros: I worked with great nurses and techs (except one LAZY, unfair clinical coordinator) that helped the nights go by without us all drowning.
cons: Only one house supervisor had experience on the floor and honestly had no clue as to what they were doing. Of course they didn't care. A lot of unethical behavior went on. Lots of favoritism. It was like a secret high school society.

review_title: I've worked as a staff nurse for several years at two of the company locations and became a supervisor.

cons: Heavy workload. I have to swallow my food whole sometimes thats if I even get to have a lunch. I rarely even get a chance to use the restroom. Over worked a lot of the time.

cons: Your just a number. This company is of course very large, and when I had a serious issue of concern about my job, the Human Resources Department had absolutely no time for me

job_title: Registered Nurse in Smiths Station, AL
pros: The hospital had good benefits and majority of the staff got along well within their own unit. My director had the best of intentions, just spread to thin between my floor and the other floor they were over.
cons: High turnover rate. Young staff. The majority of the staff- Nursing, CNA, and MCT- are constantly dealing with shortages and get pulled to other floors. Unprofessional behavior is not reprimanded. People feel under appreciated.

job_title: Comfort Care Provider (CCP) in Roslyn, NY
pros: Self-scheduling, pretty good health insurance for part-timers (.5 hrs and above), paid training (although it will not transfer as a state certification; only applicable within the hospital).
cons: The hospital tends to run short staffed from what I've experienced which translates into a  trickle down effect of stress among the employees. Because staffing tends to be tight it can be difficult to find coverage. Sick and vacation time accrual is minimal.

pros: the pay is decent for what we do
cons: Some of the nurses are lazy and half way do their jobs. They pretend as if they don't know what the role of our job is The CNA's don't like to issue breaks accordingly and have attitudes when you won't do work outside of your job titles, along with some nurses.

review_title: i loved it.i cooked for retail,patients and the doctors lounge.
pros: i was a friendly enviroment everyone respect each other we worked together it was a fun experinnce there.
cons: they have a strong policy about attendance which is understandable,when a person has major car trouble its had to get to work,knowing they still have a business to run.that was my only problem.not them it was me.

pros:
some of the staff is nice i really have nothing else better to say about the place 
if you have a family member there DO NOT LEAVE THEM ALONE
cons:
management does not listen they are always at meetings like to micro manage you 
they let the lazy people get away with stuff and always has excuses for them
over worked not enough staff 
they let the doctors treat you like crap
the leadership at that hospital needs to go and they need to clean house

review_title: leadership didn't have any knowledge of what thier job was.
job_title: Secior Radiologic Technologist in Columbus, GA
pros: I loved working for the physicians.  The patient load was demanding. I had holidays off t be with family.
cons: The management was very uneducated.  She only had a high school education, but the good old boy system got her the director job.  We had to work late due to patient overbooking.  The management didn't have a clue how to manage a medical practice.

job_title: Bachelor of Science Nursing ICU in Monroe, LA
pros: Nice staff at the hospital, great and firendliy working condition, rather good patients even if they are not as great the hospital has your back
cons: Pay is rather low but higher than the cities normal pay, the age of the staff in general, Monroe is not the center of the world

review_title: Treated well but is definitely a good ol' boy system
pros: not just a number, excellent retirement, fair policies and procedures, trusted hospital system, great autonomy.
cons: it seems you have to know someone to grow in the system. For lateral transfer or moving up, you have to know the hiring person or know someone that can put a word in for you.

job_title: Certified Nurse's Assistant in Evanston, IL
pros: Co workers, one of the primary reasons this hospital has stayed in business it the floor staff, not management just the floor staff.
cons: Budgets is poor, thus lack of new equipment or just proper stocking is a regular problem, but the staff makes little look like a lot. surrounding area to a certain degree is also questionable.

pros: The people that work their are nice to work with. And friendly environment. And this is a place you get to see all different people from different countries. All walks of life....
cons: Their are none for me. It's how you motivate your self.....

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Maryville, MO
pros:
Small town is lovely!
Coworkers are mostly nice.
cons: Rotating schedules are insane. Expect to rotate from day shift to night shift within a 24 hour period. No regard to work life balance. Sexual harassment is ignored for months. Management does not care. Shady lab practices all around, expired reagents, bad QC e.t.c. This is a BAD lab. The problems are deep seated and endemic it will take an overhaul to fix. Run!

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Columbus, GA
pros: Worked with a lot of great people and enjoyed speaking to many patients. Clean environment.
cons: New company buy out with more strict guidelines in terms of not as helpful to patient financial needs. Removed a lot of positions in the billing department. Benefits became more expensive and no raises w/in 5 years of employment to help with yearly insurance changes/premiums.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Columbus, GA
pros:
Everyone (in the ER) gets along for the most part and is a big happy family. 
Registration works 7 days on 7 days off. 
Work/life balance
cons:
Definitely the amount of staff turnover, mostly younger college kids. 
The amount of repetition involved on a daily basis. 
Lack of communication between supervisors themselves.

review_title: Great Company, Not Enough Pay For Work
pros: St. Francis is a great company to work for, with great benefits like paid time off, funeral pay, extended sick leave and reasonable insurance.
cons:
You won't get ahead working here.
You get a 3% raise each year, but insurance usually goes up 2-5% each year. 
So when applying put a higher starting pay.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Columbus, GA
pros: Everyday is a different scenario.
cons: Was full time but switch to PRN due to being promised higher pay for losing my benefits... never happened.Pay, Management, Being Safe at the Work Place, false promises for pay and advancement. Just all-in-all a terrible place to work at all together!

job_title: Medical Assistant in Monkey Island, OK
pros:
Highly motivated , dependable medical & dental assistant. Proven ability to initiate appropriate action, follow instructions and curry out tasks in an efficient manner. Proficient in patient care, medical management, coordination and emergency room techniques. Team player with effective
interpersonal communication skills and a positive  can-do attitude.
cons: not known at this time

pros: Compassionate co-workers, physicians and ancillary staff. Management encourages personal and professional growth. Good pay and benefits. Charity work for underserved population.
cons: The location is in underserved area and the majority of patients come from unprivileged background with very little resources, low socioeconomic status, and minimal education.

review_title: Enter patient information into the computer system.
job_title: Patient Information Representative in Tulsa, OK
pros: Great coworkers. There's a shift for any schedule. Uniform for every department so you're not wondering what to wear each day.
cons: Surprised at the low salaries of nurses. But it could be the region's low cost of living. Patients can get upset easily, but that's what happens when you work in customer service.

pros: They are willing to pay to further your education.   They do on job training.  The people and clients are wonderful.
cons: You need to be disciplinced in time management.   When one of the facilities was xlosing we were kept in the dark till the last few weeks.   They did find us placement

pros: They have great benefits and the pay is good, especially if you work night shift and weekends.
cons: No place for advancement, stuck at same level and pay. Too much favoritism, gossip and drama.

pros:
Great employees.
Decent benefits.
Tuition reimbursement, must stay a year after it it granted.
cons:
Bonuses for Nurses and Doctors, no raises of bonuses for other staff members.
Many directors and managers have been here a long time, outdated thinking.
Punitive and retalitory environment.
Manger will block transfers as means of payback
Your work and day to day activities are monitored, no monitoring for senior staff.

pros: Great "family" type atmosphere. Caring for employees. Great opportunity for advancement.
cons: Big problem here is parking. Employees not happy with their parking conditions. No secured patient units for safety.

pros: Several opportunities to learn new skills that are required for the procedure; friendly coworkers with great work ethics; welcome suggestions and comments on processes
cons: Organizational changes led to some difficulty in understanding processes; insufficient staff to manage the projects leading to bottlenecks in terms of work flow; fewer opportunities for growth

pros: Probably the best place I've ever worked!
cons:
Safety for healthcare workers should be stepped up for protection.
Back injuries are very high therefore placing teams of 2 should be in every patient room.

pros: Regular hours, breaks and lunches as promised.
cons: Micro-management and sometimes workers are sent home if patient volumes get low.

job_title: Physician Advisor in Port Washington, NY
pros: St. Francis is the finest hospital I've ever been privileged to work at.  Clinical excellence and compassionate leadership has created family-like comradeship.  Everything is organized for the benefit of the patients.
cons: Construction of  the new wing has temporarily disabled my elevator.

pros: The people both staff and patients. It makes you feel good to work there. You are part of a team that makes a difference in peoples lives.
cons: At one time I didn't get along with my boss

pros: Challenging but very fast paced at times.
cons: Sometimes so fast, you wonder why it's just assigned to 1 person.

review_title: If you have experience look elsewhere
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Port Washington, NY
pros: The hiring process was easy and the training is very in depth. They will hire you with no experience.
cons: You have to complete competency requirements every month. They require PCA’s to read EKG’s and the pay isn’t any higher than other hospitals.

pros: Always trying to find ways to improve patient care and patient satisfaction. Supervisors and management work with you and are flexible with schedules. Very accommodating for military families.
cons: Feel disconnected from upper management/administration. Cater to physicians needs and wants more than staff employees.

pros: Flexible Schedule and Hours for PT staff.
cons: Benefits are very expensive for PT employees. Too much work load and not enough staff. Unrealistic expectations for auxiliary staff.

review_title: good place to work if your not a union member
job_title: Patient Access Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great colleagues, decent pay, great location
cons: hard to move up in the company since most positions are union.  Even if you have the experience someone with more seniority will take the position over you.

review_title: St. Francis is very much like the other hospitals in the area
pros: Staff is friendly.  Work load is similar to that of other hospitals in the area.
cons: secretive management, constant reviewing from outside agencies, No flexibility in job hour

pros: Part of the MNA union. Much better pay than the rest of the twin cities hospitals.  Good benefits
cons: Chronically understaffed. High stress level. Current manager retired early because stressful environment

pros: A great place to work and meet new people each day. Still new to the hospital with less than 2 years working there.
cons: There are good days and there are better days. It's up to the person to make it a great day.

pros: A lot of the staff is pleasant to work with.
cons: It is very difficult to request and receive any time off. I was hired on as a part time employee they worked me 40+ hours and i never received benefits.

review_title: Poor leadership trying to keep up
pros: The people & coworkers are nice
cons: The salary is low, without annual raises

pros: close to home, it is a pretty good hospital

management likes to go to meetings and at times puts them as the most important thing

pros: Friendly atmosphere, low pressure environment, monthly goals are always attainable with hard work.

pros: Nice job with good benefits and good pay.
